author: Akayla Gardner, Stephanie Lai
description: US President Donald Trump said that his administration may begin sending out letters to trading partners as soon as Friday setting unilateral tariff rates ahead of a July 9 deadline for negotiations.
title: Trump May Start Telling Nations New Tariff Rates on Friday

author: Alicia A. Caldwell
description: Prominent Mexican boxer Julio César Chávez Jr. was arrested by US immigration authorities this week and faces swift deportation to Mexico, the Department of Homeland Security said.
title: Mexican Boxer Chávez Jr. Arrested by ICE, Faces Deportation

author: Viktoria Dendrinou, Sotiris Nikas, Paul Tugwell
description: In the summer of 2015, the country stood on the economic precipice. Now, its finances are the envy of Europe — despite the scars.
title: Greece’s Painful Decade of Rehabilitation Rewards the Believers

author: Mathieu Dion, Brian Platt
description: Canada’s finance minister said the country can negotiate a better trade deal with the Trump administration than other nations have received, pushing back on the idea that it may have to settle for a new baseline tariff on all exports to the US.
title: Canada’s Finance Minister Sees Path to Avoid Baseline US Tariff

author: Alicia Diaz
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, Congress reporter Alicia Diaz recounts a week to remember on Capitol Hill. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: No-Sleep Nights, Record-Setting Speech Mark Trump Tax Bill Week

author: Rachel Cohrs Zhang
description: Republicans in Congress finally settled on a massive legislative package aimed at realizing President Donald Trump’s domestic agenda, and it won’t come cheap. The bill the Senate and House of Representatives approved in July for Trump to sign into law cuts taxes by some $4.5 trillion over a decade and adds hundreds of billions of dollars in new spending for defense, border wall construction, immigrant detention centers and other administration priorities.
title: How Medicaid Cuts Will Cost Some 12 Million People Health Coverage

author: Jarrell Dillard, Mark Niquette
description: After days of negotiations and last-minute dealmaking, the US Congress passed a multitrillion-dollar tax and spending bill securing President Donald Trump’s domestic policy agenda.
title: A Guide to Trump’s Tax and Policy Bill That Congress Passed

author: Alicia A. Caldwell
description: Prominent Mexican boxer Julio César Chávez Jr. was arrested by US immigration authorities this week and faces swift deportation to Mexico, the Department of Homeland Security said.
title: Boxer Julio César Chávez Jr. Arrested by ICE, Faces Deportation

author: Kyle Stock
description: Sales are likely to dip below forecasts but not completely bottom out thanks to an array of new models and incentives from states and dealers.
title: What Killing Tax Credits Means for the Electric Vehicle Market

author: Manuela Tobias
description: The sharp divides roiling Latin American politics were visible in a pair of hugs.
title: Lula Hugs It Out With Milei, But Saves Warm Embrace for Kirchner

author: Anika Arora Seth, Emma Haidar, Brunella Tipismana Urbano
description: Harvard University staff advised international students to be cautious about social media posts and warned some groups against arriving at Boston’s Logan International Airport.
title: Harvard Cautions Foreign Students Over US Airports, Social Media

author: Erik Wasson, Steven T. Dennis, Maeve Sheehey
description: President Donald Trump secured a sweeping shift in US domestic policy as the House passed a $3.4 trillion fiscal package that cuts taxes, curtails spending on safety-net programs and reverses much of Joe Biden’s efforts to move the country toward a clean-energy economy.
title: Trump Wins Broad Economic Policy Shift as House Passes Tax Bill

author: Mark Niquette, Romaine Bostick, Matthew Miller
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent dismissed the idea that the dollar’s recent declines raise concerns about its status as the world’s key currency.
title: Bessent Rejects Worries Over Dollar’s Decline Diminishing Its Global Role

author: Jenny Leonard, Catherine Lucey
description: President Donald Trump’s administration is reaching out to business executives to weigh interest in accompanying him on a possible trip to China this year, according to people familiar with the matter, highlighting the potential for strengthening ties between the economies even as the US signals its desire to decouple from Beijing.
title: Trump Aides Envision Presidential Trip to China With CEOs in Tow

author: Patricia Laya
description: US-Colombia relations took a turn for the worse Thursday with both sides recalling their top envoys and the South American country’s foreign relations minister quitting unexpectedly.
title: US Recalls Top Colombia Diplomat as Once-Warm Relations Sour

author: Ryan Chua
description: The US took fresh steps to restrict the trade of Iranian oil, keeping up pressure on Iran even as President Donald Trump signaled possible relief after bombing its nuclear facilities.
title: US Keeps Up ‘Maximum Pressure’ on Iran With New Oil Sanctions

author: Ellen M Gilmer, Alicia A. Caldwell, Hadriana Lowenkron
description: US immigration enforcement is set for the most dramatic expansion in decades with the Republican-controlled Congress on track to approve a budget bill that will fund President Donald Trump’s mass deportation plans.
title: US Immigration Crackdown to Intensify With $150 Billion Infusion

author: Anthony Halpin
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin and Donald Trump discussed Ukraine in phone talks on Thursday, with the Kremlin indicating that little progress was made in the US president’s efforts to bring an end to the war.
title: Kremlin Signals Putin-Trump Call Made Little Progress on Ukraine

author: James Mayger
description: The Chinese government intends to cancel part of a summit with European Union leaders planned for later this month, in the latest sign of the tensions between Brussels and Beijing.
title: China Set to Cancel Part of EU Summit in Latest Strain on Ties

author: Stephanie Lai
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said that President Donald Trump will make the call on any extension of talks with trading partners past the July 9 deadline for higher tariff rates to kick back in.
title: Bessent Says Trump to Decide on Any Extension of July 9 Tariff Deadline

author: Jamie Tarabay, Steven T. Dennis
description: Business investors and wealthy Americans are among the biggest winners in President Donald Trump’s tax bill. Those hit the hardest by the sweeping package include elite universities, who face new levies, and immigrants.
title: Who Won and Lost in Trump’s Tax Bill

author: Simone Iglesias, S'thembile Cele, Martha Viotti Beck
description: Ever since BRICS was founded more than a decade ago, the group of emerging-market nations has struggled to identify a common purpose. President Donald Trump’s tariffs may have solved that problem.
title: BRICS Aspires to Occupy Global Ground Vacated by US Under Trump

author: Godfrey Marawanyika, Ray Ndlovu
description: Zimbabwe’s ruling party added sanctioned tycoon Kudakwashe Tagwirei to its highest decision-making body, a move that could further strain relations with the US and other Western nations.
title: Zimbabwe Ruling Party Adds Sanctioned Tycoon to Leadership Ranks

author: Laura Avetisyan
description: Russia is regularly switching off mobile internet connections in large swaths of the country for security reasons, in a sign of the Kremlin’s growing ability to control popular access to technology.
title: Russian Internet Outages Soar as Kremlin Boosts War Controls

author: Akayla Gardner
description: President Donald Trump’s visit to Iowa on Thursday is ostensibly to kick off a yearlong celebration leading up to America’s 250th anniversary. But his trip also casts a spotlight on the intense dynamics of his nascent second term as well as questions over who will barnstorm the critical state come 2028 as his successor.
title: Trump Visits Iowa While 2028 Republicans Wait for Their Chance

author: Michael O'Boyle, Eric Martin
description: Top bank executives gathered at a luxury resort off Mexico’s Pacific coast encountered an unexpected guest at an annual convention in May. A high-level official with the US Treasury Department had flown down to the soiree — where rooms ran as much as $900 a night — to deliver a firm warning.
title: Cartel Money Crackdown Has Mexican Banks Reeling From Sanctions

author: Laura Nahmias, Gregory Korte
description: Curtis Sliwa said he won’t drop out of the race for New York mayor, regardless of the pressure applied or incentives offered to the Republican candidate.
title: Curtis Sliwa Says He Won’t Quit NYC Mayor’s Race

author: Michael Cohen, Paul Vecchiatto
description: David Mabuza, who shrugged off a succession of graft scandals to become South Africa’s deputy president, has died. He was 64.
title: David Mabuza, Former South African Deputy President, Dies at 64

author: Maeve Sheehey, Jonathan Tamari
description: House Democratic Leader Hakeem Jeffries is blocking a final vote on Republicans’ tax and spending package with a lengthy floor speech bashing the bill.
title: Democrat Jeffries Delays House Vote on Trump Tax Bill With Marathon Speech

author: Erik Larson
description: Immigrant-rights groups and Democratic-led states challenging President Donald Trump’s limits on birthright citizenship have changed their strategies after a Supreme Court decision upended their initial legal victories.
title: Immigrant Groups Switch Tactics to Fight Trump Birthright Limits

author: Catherine Lucey
description: US President Donald Trump said he would speak to Russian leader Vladimir Putin on Thursday, the latest call in his effort to broker an end to the war in Ukraine.
title: Trump to Talk to Putin on Thursday as He Seeks Ukraine Truce

author: Patrick Sykes
description: Iran will continue to engage with the UN’s nuclear watchdog even after it announced the suspension of cooperation, the country’s top diplomat said, boosting hopes for oversight of its contested atomic program despite Israel’s attacks.
title: Iran Says Cooperation With UN Nuclear Inspectors to Continue

author: Greg Stohr
description: The US Supreme Court turned away a new effort to restrict abortion, declining to hear arguments that parents have a constitutional right to prevent their underage child from ending a pregnancy.
title: Supreme Court Declines to Require Parental Consent for Abortion

author: Greg Stohr
description: The US Supreme Court agreed to decide whether states can ban transgender girls and women from competing for their schools on female athletic teams, heeding conservative calls to consider further curbing LGBTQ rights.
title: Supreme Court to Review Bans on Trans Athletes in Female Sports

author: Nguyen Dieu Tu Uyen, Nguyen Xuan Quynh
description: Vietnam said negotiators are still working to finalize the details of the trade deal announced by US President Donald Trump, providing little clarity to businesses and investors beyond the tariff rates disclosed so far.
title: Vietnam Still Finalizing Trade Deal Already Announced by Trump

author: Fares Alghoul, Dan Williams
description: Israel is intensifying military operations in one of the last Hamas strongholds in Gaza, as the sides stake out positions before ceasefire negotiations proposed by US President Donald Trump.
title: Israel Pushes to Gain Ground in Gaza as Hamas Weighs Ceasefire

author: Manuela Tobias, Kevin Simauchi
description: There is a silver lining for Javier Milei in a multibillion-dollar US judgment targeting Argentina’s main oil producer: At least some investors see the libertarian leader as having a shot at finally putting an end to a long-running legal saga.
title: Investors See Way for Milei to End Fight Over State Oil Company

author: Oscar Medina, Andrea Jaramillo
description: Colombian Foreign Minister Laura Sarabia quit on Thursday, the latest in a series of high-profile defections to shake the leftist administration of President Gustavo Petro.
title: Colombia’s Foreign Minister Quits, Deepening Petro’s Woes

author: Greg Sullivan
description: A high-ranking Russian navy commander was killed on Wednesday, one of the most senior military casualties since the start of the war in Ukraine.
title: Russian Navy’s Deputy Commander Gudkov Killed During Combat

author: Daryna Krasnolutska
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy is likely to hold a phone call with Donald Trump on Friday to discuss the US decision to pause the transfer of artillery rounds and air defenses to Ukraine, a person familiar with the matter said.
title: Zelenskiy to Discuss Halt in US Weapon Deliveries With Trump

author: William Selway
description: UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves said her emotional appearance in Parliament on Wednesday was caused by a personal issue that wasn’t related to her work with Prime Minister Keir Starmer.
title: UK’s Reeves Says ‘Personal Issue’ Behind Emotional Appearance

author: Nacha Cattan, Natalie Wong, Laura Nahmias
description: Billionaire investor Bill Ackman called on Andrew Cuomo to step aside from the New York City mayoral race and allow incumbent Eric Adams to take on democratic socialist Zohran Mamdani in November.
title: Bill Ackman Backs Adams in NYC Mayor's Race

author: William Wilkes, Alberto Nardelli, Ashleigh Furlong
description: German automaker Mercedes-Benz Group AG, French luxury giant LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton SE and other major European firms are spearheading a corporate push that’s weakening the European Union’s efforts to stand up to Donald Trump’s tariff threats.
title: Mercedes to LVMH Are Blunting the EU’s Fight Against Trump’s Tariffs

author: Sofia Sorochinskaia
description: Russia is seeking to seize assets from the family of a billionaire that owns one of the country’s largest gold miners.
title: Russia to Seize Top Gold Miner From Billionaire, Tass Reports

author: Nicholas Comfort, Michael Nienaber
description: Chancellor Friedrich Merz signaled he won’t give up Germany’s opposition to joint European Union deposit insurance, a scheme large banks view as key to forging closer financial ties in the bloc.
title: Merz Signals Germany Won’t Compromise on Bank Deposit Protection

author: Michael Sasso
description: The historic city, known for gardens and gothic mystery, is leaving no stone unturned as it helps the South Korean auto giant staff up a futuristic new factory
title: Savannah Bet Its Economy on a Big Hyundai Plant. Now It Has to Find the Workers

author: Alan Crawford
description: As he prepares to mark his first year in power, the prime minister is finding defeat around every turn.
title: It’s a Brutal Anniversary for Britain’s Starmer

author: James Mayger, Lucille Liu
description: President Donald Trump’s new trade deal with Vietnam sends a clear signal about where US tariffs on Chinese goods might ultimately land, as talks between Washington and Beijing continue following their recent truce.
title: Trump’s Vietnam Deal Shows China Tariffs Won’t Fall Much Further

author: Catherine Lucey, Nancy Cook
description: With President Donald Trump’s budget megabill all but wrapped up and the Iran crisis subsiding, trade wars are back center-stage in Washington — putting Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick where he’s happiest: in the thick of the action.
title: Lutnick Nears Crunch Time to Deliver on His Trade-Deal Swagger

author: Tom Rees, Irina Anghel
description: Signs of the UK economy picking up after a downbeat spring emerged in new surveys that will provide a much-needed boost for Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves.
title: Surveys Show UK Economy Rebounding From Labour Taxes, US Tariffs

author: Ellen Milligan
description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer promised his government will adhere to strict budget rules as he sought to calm market jitters about Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves’ future.
title: Starmer Vows to Stick to Budget Rules After UK Selloff Over Reeves Fears

author: Claire Jiao, Philip Heijmans, Katia Dmitrieva
description: President Donald Trump’s two-tiered trade deal with Vietnam aims squarely at practices China has long used to skirt US tariffs: The widespread legal shifting of production to Southeast Asian factories and the murkier and illegal “origin washing” of exports through their ports.
title: Trump Aims to Shut Trade Loopholes China Uses to Evade Tariffs

author: James Mayger, Yujing Liu
description: China said it was examining a trade deal that the US and Vietnam clinched and would retaliate if its interests were hurt — a sign that tensions between Beijing and Washington risk worsening as more of the pacts are finalized.
title: China Vows Retaliation If It’s Hurt by US-Vietnam Trade Deal

author: Grace Sihombing
description: The US and Indonesia will sign trade and investment pacts worth $34 billion as part of efforts to secure a deal on tariffs ahead of a July 9 deadline.
title: Indonesia Says $34 Billion in Trade, Investment MOU With US in Pipeline

author: Erica Yokoyama
description: Japan’s annual wage negotiations concluded with the largest pay increase in 34 years, according to the final tally released by the country’s biggest labor union group, an outcome that supports the central bank’s view that a cycle of higher wages and prices is emerging.
title: Japan’s 2025 Wage Talks Conclude With Highest Gain in 34 Years

author: Colum Murphy, Jing Li
description: A senior Chinese official said he was “optimistic” about the future of his nation’s ties with the US, among the most upbeat comments given by Beijing in recent weeks about a relationship upended by Donald Trump’s trade war.
title: Senior Chinese Diplomat Upbeat on US Ties, Says War Unimaginable

author: Pathom Sangwongwanich
description: Thailand’s suspended Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra was sworn in as a cabinet minister Thursday, a maneuver allowing her to attend ministerial meetings while awaiting the results of a court review of her alleged misconduct.
title: Suspended Thai Leader Sworn In as Minister in New Cabinet Lineup

author: Kamil Kowalcze
description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz’s ruling coalition rebuffed calls to expand a discounted electricity tax to include households and additional companies, saying they’ll only do so when they have “financial leeway.”
title: German Coalition Resists Calls for Broader Electricity-Tax Cut

author: Galit Altstein, Ethan Bronner
description: When Donald Trump demanded an end to Benjamin Netanyahu’s corruption trial at the weekend, many dismissed it as an unwelcome interference in Israel’s judicial system.
title: Trump Call to End Netanyahu Trial Spurs Israeli Debate on Pardon

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thai Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra faces an uncertain future and could become the third leader from the Shinawatra clan member to lose power over the past 19 years.
title: Four Things to Watch in Thai Political Crisis After Prime Minister Suspended

author: Robert Burnson
description: Kilmar Abrego Garcia was severely beaten, deprived of sleep and subjected to psychological torture at an El Salvador mega-prison after he was wrongly deported by the Trump administration, his lawyers said in a court filing.
title: Abrego Garcia Says He Was Beaten, Tortured in El Salvador Prison

author: Soo-Hyang Choi, Hyonhee Shin
description: South Korean President Lee Jae Myung pledged to revive the faltering economy and improve living standards, speaking Thursday in his first press conference since taking office last month.
title: Lee Vows to Focus on Reviving South Korea’s Sputtering Economy

author: Mackenzie Hawkins
description: Siemens AG has received a notice from the US government saying that Washington has lifted export restrictions on chip design software for China.
title: Siemens Says US Has Rescinded Chip Software Curbs on China

author: Ameya Karve
description: Singapore Prime Minister Lawrence Wong has called for restraint and dialogue between Thailand and Cambodia, urging an amicable resolution to their border dispute in line with international law.
title: Singapore’s Wong Urges Restraint in Thai-Cambodia Border Dispute

author: Swati Pandey
description: A new trade deal between the US and Vietnam risks provoking retaliatory steps from China as the accord includes a 40% tariff on goods deemed to be transshipped through the Southeast Asian country, according to Bloomberg Economics.
title: US-Vietnam Deal Risks China Reprisal, Bloomberg Economics Says
